intro: Galium decipiens var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine pubescence. This variant is distinguished by its smoother, less hairy appearance compared to other varieties of Galium decipiens.
